lexUnit.name: mighty.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: possessing great power, strength, or force

sentence.text: He was the mightiest warrior of his age , and he led the terrifying Unberogens into battle against the Orcs countless times .
The Empire 's greatest general and the mightiest Orc Warlord of the age fell upon each other with the fury of ancient enemies .
` Both are built on seven hills , both have been the pleasure centres of mighty empires .
He is a chivalric hero , a mighty slayer of the Danes , a triumpher in single combat , a victor over the invading German hordes .
Discovering that the man who has been passing threats to me is the mighty Tod Richardson will not help me sleep peacefully in my bed .
` There must be a mighty uproar from commuter areas to end this threat to off-peak rail services . "
Mighty figures clad in light sent the surge of mystical power tumbling back to Nagarythe .
Gammon swung the antique warming-pan with a will and struck the Cerean a mighty blow to the back of the head .
The earth shook again as two mighty hammers pounded cooling plates of iron .
He was a mighty soldier , a veteran of countless battles .
She saw it struggling against a mighty wind , but unable to smite anything tangible within its .
These mighty creatures made their lairs beneath the blazing peaks of the Dragon Spine Mountains .
The truly mighty storms are remembered for years , though the frequency of destructive typhoons is depressingly high in some corners of the Pacific -- the Philippines , for instance , and Japan .
Orkney 's largest trout was caught in Stenness and this mighty fish weighed 29 lb 8 oz .
As though carried by a mighty flood to its remote hilltop , surrounded by trees , and then abandoned as the water receded , the barrow is an almost alien presence .
The audiences at the first performances of The Creation in Vienna in the late 1790s were entranced by Haydn 's musical depictions of every living creature from the mighty eagle to the lowly worm .
Both mighty leaders staggered with pain as the battle swirled around them .
King David of the Old Testament had mighty men to enforce discipline , so did David Koresh .
The Sword Masters are so superlatively trained that they can wield these mighty swords as fast as an ordinary warrior can a normal sword .
But now he appears , or rather the people see the effects of his presence , the sweep of his mighty hand .
Even stilled , the great pistons were ample evidence of the power it could unleash , driving it like the mighty wheels of a train .
He rides a massive chariot pulled by three wolves , and swings his mighty axe Elf-Biter .
The cyclist saw one mighty arm upreared .
Had n't he studied in France and seen the men of this supposedly superior civilization living amid their mighty machines and their great institutions ?
The referee blew a toy trumpet and Harry Payne gave the golf club a mighty hit with his bat , breaking the shaft in two .
Instead of jerking on the lead , he gave a mighty push to the bear 's head and the man-animal rolled over backwards .
Mickey had a ramp with pea sized objects rolling down to be dealt a mighty blow from a spring loaded mallet .
Three mighty kicks on the ribs and it was all over .
The Quakers relied too heavily on the mighty hit rather than short passes .
That 's twice with the chief , thought Rex , who rather than have his head mashed by a slamming door , put his boot against it and offered a mighty kick .
Daly , whose mighty hitting swept him to fairytale victory in last year 's PGA Championship at Crooked Stick , played the same hole with a drive and eight-iron .
` I have learned that the love Christ gives to us is a mighty power .

And in doing so she has proved herself a mightier force than the Palace propaganda machine , which suggested that she might not attend because she was too old and frail to make the long journey to Crathie Church .
Dining at ease inside a dragon makes a good symbol of the harnessing of mighty powers of nature for man 's comfort , or perhaps of pride coming before a fall .
For the first time , the mighty strength of the United States was to be employed in a truly international conflict .
But a Vietnam with a difference , for the whites , armed to the teeth and economically mighty , will fight as the South Vietnamese and the Americans never did .
This constant cycle of warfare , involving fleets as mighty as the Spanish Armada , had kept Bouton in isolation up to the present day .
But where the mighty minds of the world failed dismally , the Mirror got it right .
They sat quietly in Jerusalem until the Spirit came upon them at Pentecost ; then they could not keep quiet about the mighty deeds of God .
